content.description: Hard scrunchy moves leading up to a tough sloper mantel. The big sidepull is quite sharp, so consider taping up
content.location:
Around the corner to the right of Mind the Gap.

Start low and move out left to the big sharp sidepull and pray that friction is good for the topout

content.description:
Beta and friction dependent. Start on holds at chest height and crank over the lip onto slopers.

Feels impossible in the sun.
content.location: On the Conditions boulder, opposite side of where Push and Pull is. Two routes climb this face of the boulder, Short and Hard starts towards the right.

content.description: Amazing line up a tall slab. Got up to the upper half, but couldn't figure it out by the time we left the Bighorns. A classic for sure!
content.location: On the very right side of the Fruit Basket, around the corner from Hearburn. Start on waist high holds and work your way up the crooked crack to the top

content.description:
Great boulder with several short problems. This one in particular is excellent with a crux sloper mantel.

Before climbing, go to the top and kick off any marmot shit that has been recently deposited...
content.location: One of the closer boulders to the road. Start at your hip on the right side and climb up and left through the overlap in the rock to featureless slopey topout. A direct top out can be done, but isn't quite as good as going left.

content.description:
Great problem with a fun slopey topout.

Left of Short and Hard, start on holds at chest height and climb left into the dihedral and up to the slopers at the lip.

Get on this one when the sun has gone down a little bit
content.location: Just to the left of Short and Hard on the Conditions boulder

content.description: Decent little problem, be sure to kick off the marmot shit on top
content.location:
To the left of Push and Pull.

Start at hip height and make a few moves to the awkward topout

content.description: Fun traverse on a series of interesting holds. Crux comes at the end and revolves around a move up to the lip with poor feet.
content.location:
The small boulder right across from Push and Pull.

Start on the right side of the boulder on crimps at waist height, traverse left through interesting moves and around the corner to finish on a jug at the lip

content.description: Great mantel problem through perfect rock
content.location: Around the corner from Push and Pull, ascend the less than vertical face using anything you can at the top to mantel.
